item.title: Report E-2025030454
item.description:
Report E-2025030454

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver returned from making waste pickup at customer in Brentwood NY. Driver noticed small amount of material around drum when arriving at the facility. It was found that there is a pinhole in the bottom of the drum. Material cleaned up and drum overpacked. No release to the environment, no injuries. About a cup of material released. Profile 60-2605.

item.title: Report E-2025030178
item.description:
Report E-2025030178

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/08/2025, at 1313 hours, personnel at the CSX yard in Selkirk, New York, reported product leaking from inside the valve box of car IAPX 1084, a tank car residue: last contained, Argon, refrigerated liquid. The car was isolated and the customer, Airgas, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-03-08-00044). David Scoons, a CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials, responded to the incident along with HEPACO a CSX emergency response contractor. It was determined the cause of the release was due to the liquid line valve being partially and the secondary securement not properly applied. Response personnel closed the valve properly secured the valve and secondary securement stopping the release. The shipper’s representative, George Ryan (518-526-3322), was notified of the condition found and the corrective actions taken.
